dc:title: On Pilgrimage - July-August 194
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Contrasts the hustle and bustle around Maryfarm--retreats and visitors--with the quiet life of her daughter Tamar's farm in West Virginia. While peaceful and meditative, rural life often means loneliness, hard work, and poverty.
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 264 1948-07-01 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
